title: Ticket #6562: python binding SecMan().ping() fails if private network defined
description:
If the python API htcondor.Secman().ping() method is used to ping an HTCondor daemon that specified a PRIVATE_NETWORK_INTERFACE, the ping() call throws a RuntimeError exception with the following message: 

   RuntimeError: No valid entry in command map hash table!

To reproduce, setup a personal condor configured something like so: 

   use role:personal
   COLLECTOR.PRIVATE_NETWORK_INTERFACE = 10.140.83.20
   COLLECTOR.PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME = WhatEver

Then the following Python code will exhibit the problem: 

   import htcondor
   coll = htcondor.Collector('localhost')
   ad = coll.locate(htcondor.DaemonTypes.Collector)
   print(htcondor.SecMan().ping(ad, 'READ'))

An interesting observation is the condor_ping command line tool will still work, however.
remarks:
2018-Feb-08 17:01:09 by tannenba:
Note that if you are specifically trying to ping an HTCondor Collector, until an upgrade to HTCondor Python bindings v8.6.10+ is done, a workaround would be to provide the ping() method a string with just an ip address and port (like '<10.4.0.0:9618>') instead of a ClassAd. Like so: 

   import htcondor
   import socket
   addr = socket.gethostbyname('hostname.with.my.collector.edu')
   print( htcondor.SecMan().ping('<{}:9618>'.format(addr),'READ') )

2018-Feb-08 17:06:01 by blin:
When you say that an upgrade to 8.6.10+ is required for it to work, is this server-side, client-side, or both?

2018-Feb-08 17:11:39 by tannenba:
Just an upgrade of the client side (ie an upgrade of the htcondor PIP package) is required.
